content:
Hi folks. What's the status of proposals to add a Golang-like struct embedding / delegation feature to Rust? By this I mean something akin to what's described in this Shepmaster stackoverflow answer https://stackoverflow.com/a/32552698 . Discussion I find on the internet is all several years old and it seems the topic has become dormant. I often find myself wishing Rust has this feature. Quoting Shepmaster from the above link:

However, I do hold out hope for a language feature that enables succinct _delegation_, reducing the annoyance of composition.

Probably better to ask in #t-lang; but as far as that RFC in particular, it hasn't seen significant activity in a while, so it's probably not on the lang team's radar, at least in the short term. Definitely someone from the lang-team should weigh in :)
(they discussed the RFC briefly last year in their "backlog bonanza": video)
My recollection was that that RFC was generally liked, but there were some questions about how it would extend and what specific restrictions an MVP would have.
Thanks all! I'll cross-post to #t-lang
